We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is presenting with signs of sepsis, altered mental status, and bleeding complications. The positive blood and urine cultures for Escherichia coli suggest disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC), a common complication in sepsis. The treatment of DIC includes volume resuscitation, antibiotics to control the infection, and blood component therapy. Cryoprecipitate, fresh frozen plasma (FFP), and low dose subcutaneous (SC) heparin are used to replenish clotting factors and control bleeding. Prednisone therapy is not indicated in DIC. Plasma exchange is used in some cases of severe DIC, but it is not the initial treatment of choice. Splenectomy is not indicated in DIC.
